meanings.definition: Colossuses: plural form of colossus, meaning a statue or monument that is very large and impressive in size.
meanings.sent1: The colossuses in the park were towering over the trees.
meanings.sent2: Tourists from around the world come to see the ancient colossuses.
meanings.sent3: The colossuses decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was a colossus that overshadowed any other trait he had.
meanings.sent5: The colossuses gleamed in the sunlight, casting long shadows on the ground.

meanings.definition: Colossuses: plural form of colossus, meaning a person or thing of enormous size or importance.
meanings.sent1: The business tycoon was a colossus in the industry, known for his wealth and power.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of mythical colossuses that roamed the land in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant thought the crumbs on the floor were colossuses blocking its path.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a colossus that propelled her to success against all odds.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood like a colossus, unmoving and eternal against the changing sky.
